caption: This photograph depicts a natural landscape viewed from a high vantage point. The foreground features rugged terrain with dry, sandy soil and patches of grass. Scattered throughout this area are fallen branches and pine trees. The middle ground transitions into a lush, green valley dotted with numerous trees â€“ possibly a mix of conifers and deciduous trees. Further in the distance, gently rolling hills covered in greenery span across the horizon under an overcast sky. The overall scene conveys a serene yet wild aspect of a natural, undeveloped area, emphasizing the contrast between the dry, barren foreground and the fertile valley below. The composition and perspective suggest a remote or less frequently traveled location, providing a sense of isolation and quiet natural beauty.
title: Roy Fly Ranch near Sarpy Basin. Close to the surface of the 25,000 square mile area, known as the Powder Basin, lies the largest deposit of low-sulphur coal in America. Many ranchers, who own land in the area, are refusing to sell their land to the coal companies.
